caption:
This photograph features a large signage structure that reads "MOSES CLEAVELAND LANDED HERE JULY 22 1796." The sign is comprised of bold, white block letters set within a dark frame, and it appears to be mounted on a bridge or similar structure.

In the foreground, two people are sitting on the grass facing away from the camera. They are looking towards the sign and the river visible beneath it. The individual on the left is wearing a dark short-sleeved shirt, while the person on the right has on a light-colored long-sleeved shirt. It seems like a casual, relaxed moment between them.

The background additionally includes a view of the river, which reflects light and appears slightly shimmered. There are also elements of urban development visible across the river, including buildings and possibly other structures, indicating that this scene is set in an urban park or a similar public space that combines natural and urban features. The setting appears peaceful and leisurely, with an emphasis on historical commemoration.
title: Here on the banks of the cuyahoga river general Cleveland founded a city.  Now the river is polluted and the surrounding downtown area is deteriorating
